bibl.title: Letter from J. Luther Kibler to Emilie Lawrence Reed, September 1, 1927

div1.p: Kibler requests an outline of Walter Reed's life, from Brooklyn to Cuba. He will send Emilie Lawrence Reed a photograph of the restored house in Belroi.

div1.head: Letter from J. Luther Kibler to Emilie Lawrence Reed, September 1, 1927
div1.opener:
P. O. Box 470,
Newport News, Va.
Sept. 1, 1927.
Mrs. Walter Reed,
Blue Ridge Summitt, PA.
Dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
I am returning herewith the newspaper clippings which you so
kindly loaned to me. I wish to thank you for this courtesy.

Now, it has just occurred to me that perhaps you might be able to give me
a list of the different stations in the U. S. Army Dr. Reed occupied before he
made his famous experiments. I believe he was in the West --Arizona, etc.--If
this data is not given in the book dealing with his work in Cuba, I would appre-
ciate having it. In short, I desire to know where he was and when, from year to
year, after he left Bellevue Hospital till he was sent to Cuba, including his ac-
tivities with the army in his TYPHOID FEVER sanitary work. Just the merest
outline would perhaps suffice,--if not too much of a task to request of you.

Of course, if the work (book) on his Yellow Fever work includes this, it
is not necessary for you to bother about giving this data.

Dr. Jones, here, said he was trying to get two copies of the Metropolitan
LIFE'S Story of Dr. Reed's work, and if he did he would give me one of the two
copies. Thanking you for all the information given me, I remain,
div1.closer:
Respectfully yours, J. L. Kibler.
P.S. Mr. Davidson will photograph “Belroi
Restored,” soon, this month; we will
send copy of that also.
K.
